text: The nature reserve of Wollmatinger Ried – Untersee – Gnadensee is a protected area on the shores of Lake Constance in Germany. It has an area of 767 hectares and is the largest and most important nature reserve on the German side of Lake Constance. It is rich in plant and animal species and extends from the banks of the Seerhein river west of Constance via the causeway to the Island of Reichenau in the Untersee to the eastern Gnadensee near Allensbach- Hegne. The nearby offshore islands of Triboldingerbohl (Langenrain) and Mittler or Langbohl (Kopf) are part of the reserve. == Literature == * == Sources == * nabu-wollmatingerried.de: Das Wollmatinger Ried * Regierungspräsidium Freiburg: Faltblatt zum Naturschutzgebiet Wollmatinger Ried == Reference == == External links == * www.nabu-wollmatingerried.de Category:Geography of Lake Constance Category:Nature reserves in Baden- Württemberg Category:Natura 2000 in Germany Category:IUCN Category IV Category:Konstanz (district) Category:Ramsar sites in Germany
title: Wollmatinger Ried
